sentence.idiomatic: Why don’t we take the subway? It will save us the most time.
Quickly tell me: what methods do you have for saving money?
Compared to other cars, this new model of car we are promoting can save 30% on gasoline.
More and more people have their own car now.
Some people feel that having their own car is a symbol of wealth.
He is considering whether or not to buy his own car.
He soon regretted buying this car.
If you do this, you will definitely regret it later.
Now she is regretting not listening to what you said.
These medicines can alleviate your pain, but you shouldn’t take too many.
Taking a deep breath can ease feelings of nervousness.
Do you have any good ways to alleviate fatigue?
A transportation network extending in all directions has brought visiting businessmen from home and abroad, enabling the local economy here to develop very well.
Only by constructing a transportation network that extends in all directions can we lighten the current overcrowded traffic situation.
The public transportation routes go everywhere. Taking commuter buses has already become our citizens’ most important means of transportation.
For the sake of your health, don’t lose weight recklessly.
Young people should not indiscriminately seek out brand-name products.
We shouldn’t regard our own abilities recklessly.
During the holiday period, many people choose to travel by plane.
She suggested that before we go traveling we should do thorough preparation.

word.literal: to go on a long journey

sentence.idiomatic: We haven’t yet settled on the destination we will travel to this time.
There is no end to learning.
In the face of endless waiting, she finally gave up.
Endlessly cutting down trees will destroy our ecosystem.
She suffered greatly during the course of shooting the film.
So now you’ve finally tasted suffering.
This year’s training often caused me great suffering.
Everywhere I look I see roads being dug up, how many subway lines do they want to build in Shanghai anyways?
More than ten! I really can’t wait. The state of traffic is so terrible now, taking the subway is still the most convenient and time-efficient.

That’s true. These past few years, the number of privately-owned cars has expanded too quickly. Road construction cannot keep up, so there are traffic jams all day long. A lot of my friends regret buying a car, since the time they now spend on the road is actually longer.

That’s right. Plus, fuel is so expensive, and on top of that parking in the downtown area is both expensive and inconvenient. So a lot of commuters still choose to take the subway or bus to and from work. This can alleviate traffic pressure, and is also better for the environment.

Uh-huh. Actually, I’ve always felt that the public transportation system is pretty good. The light-rail and surface transportation goes everywhere. The buses also have special lanes, so they go faster than the cars can. In addition, the fares are very low.

Yes, for a city as huge as Shanghai, to solve the traffic problem you need to rely on underground and aboveground light-rail transportation systems. These past few years, we blindly sought after private owned vehicles, because we felt they were convenient for travel. However the facts bear out that increasing the numbers of privately-owned vehicles to no end, heedless of traffic or the environment, has brought serious consequences.

Right, it seems that people must suffer a bit before they come to their senses. These past few years we ourselves dreamed every day about buying a car. Only now do we realize that public transportation was better after all.
